messages.messageBody:

knightsedgeacademy@... writes:


> another source is simplicity patterns. if you have a joanns fabric
> store in your area, watch their sale ad, (you can check it online at
> joann.com. you type in your city and it will give you the current ad
> for your area store) and they have patterns on sale for .99 for
> simplicity, mccall, butterick and vogue.

Yes. This pattern was $12.95---on sale for .99. Great deal!

~Kelly

messages.subject: idea for robe pattern
messages.msgSnippet: hi, i m new to the list, my name is alicia and we are unschooling a 8 yr old daughter and 6 yr old son, i ve been following the discussions and i have a
messages.messageBody:
hi, i'm new to the list, my name is alicia and we are unschooling a 8
yr old daughter and 6 yr old son, i've been following the discussions
and i have a possible idea for whomever was looking for a robe
pattern. this isn't harry potter, it is for a cloak for the lord of
the rings, but i'm sure it could be used for a wizard robe. anyway
here is the link...
http://www.alleycatscratch.com/lotr/Things/FCloak/FCloak_pattern.htm

another source is simplicity patterns. if you have a joanns fabric
store in your area, watch their sale ad, (you can check it online at
joann.com. you type in your city and it will give you the current ad
for your area store) and they have patterns on sale for .99 for
simplicity, mccall, butterick and vogue. i bought a bunch of patterns
for halloween (they want to be legolas and frodo) anyway hope this
helps somebody out.

pleasure being on the list,
alicia
